headline: CoinShares to Go Public in the U.S. Through US$1.2 Billion Business Combination
summary: The leading European asset manager specializing in digital assets with ~US$10 billion in AuM sets sights on expanding into U.S. market CoinShares ranks among the top four managers globally by crypto ETP AuM alongside BlackRock, Fidelity, and Grayscale and holds the #1 market position in Europe with 34% market share CoinShares is experiencing a period of significant growth; AuM has more than tripled over the last two years through strong investor inflows, supportive digital asset pricing and succ

headline: Klarna IPO Is Just One in a Long List of Companies Going Public This Week
summary: Six companies are set to go public the week of Sept. 8. Buyers should be careful: Both Circle and Figma have pulled back after big IPO pops.

headline: Ethereum ETFs Shed $788M Over Four Days in Institutional Exodus
summary: Experts cited staking restrictions and risk-off sentiment driving the institutional retreat amid recession fears and macro anxiety.

raw.headline: Ethereum ETFs Shed $788M Over Four Days in Institutional Exodus

headline: BlackRock Survey Reveals Record Retirement Confidence Gap Between Employees and their Employers
summary: NEW YORK, September 08, 2025--BlackRock’s tenth annual Read on Retirement® report marks a decade of insights into the evolving landscape of retirement readiness. This year’s findings reveal a striking confidence gap: nearly two-thirds (64%) of workplace savers feel on track with their retirement savings. In contrast, only 38% of plan sponsors believe that the majority (60%) of their employees are on track for retirement—a record low—highlighting an urgent need for targeted education, innovative

headline: Markets Could Price Fed Independence Erosion Again: Li
summary: BlackRock's Wei Li says the cooling down of the US jobs market creates "enough macro justification for the Fed to go ahead with near-term rate cuts" without the central bank's independence being brought into question. She also adds that markets could start to price back in some of the "previous independence erosion premia," which can have a positive effect on equities and bonds. Li speaks on Bloomberg Television.
